Name: Adobe Lightroom Classic
description: , alas, the best photo editing software out there. I hate Adobe, but it works so damn good. I’m doing my best to completely switch to the two following programs but, damn, it’s so hard. Also: I have to keep Lightroom on my device because it’s impossible to move photography edits committed with Lightroom to Darktable.

Name: Adobe Photoshop
description: . I tried living without it. I couldn't. Hands down, it's the best visual editing software in the world. You could do anything with it.

Name: AEScrypt
uninstalled: . I do not use it. If needed, same stuff can be done via CLI

Name: AlDente
title: source code on GitHub
description: , a MacBook utility to avoid over-charging the battery when the device is plugged and it have reached 100% charge

Name: Android File Transfer
description: , the name says it all. It’s simple and it works great.
uninstalled: . I do not own an Android device anymore.

Name: AppCleaner
description: , a neat, simple and efficient app to remove data of uninstalled apps

Name: Audacity
description: , audio editing software. I know, I have Garage Band which is awesome but… Audacity works the same way anywhere.
uninstalled: I need very little sound editing, mixing, etc: GarageBand is fine; furthermore, it's neat, simple and quick.

Name: Background Music
title: on GitHub
description: , to handle audio sources and audio recording

Name: Backtrack
description: , the Holy Graal for university students which get easily distracted (me). It allows you to recover audio up to 5 hours before. It’s not Open Source and I payed 2€ for it. Totally worth it.

Name: balenaEtcher
description: , the safest, simplest and quickest software to flash OS images to external drives.
uninstalled: I do not flash devices daily

Name: BitBar
description: , run any plugin from the top bar.

Name: Blackhole
description: , to share any file. Fast and private. Based on [Blockstack](https://blockstack.org/).

Name: Clean Me
description: , a better, neat and perfectly working alternative to CCleaner written in Swift.

Name: CopyQ
description: , a clipboard history recorder, which keeps a record of all copied text and items. It saved my life several times.

Name: Cosmicast
description: , a minimal and beautiful podcast player which syncs with iOS through iCloud. It is proprietary software and it costs 3,50€.
